DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this study was to investigate changes in abdominal tissue perfusion during adenosine vasodilation. Our hypotheses were that CT perfusion measurements are altered by changes in the circulatory system mediated by adenosine, and a more differentiated assessment of the circulatory capacity of abdominal tumours could be achieved by sequential rest and adenosine vasodilation CT perfusion measurements.
DOC.brief_title: CT Perfusion Changes in GI Cancer During Adenosine Vasodilation Test
DOC.criteria: Tumour larger than 1.5 cm on diagnostic CT Normal serum creatinine Age above 18 Informed written and oral consent. Contrast allergy or contrast induced nephropathy BMI > 40 Asthma or Chronic Obstructive Lung Disease Heart failure (NYHA III+) Heart conduction disorder Atrial fibrillation 2nd/3rd Heart block Long QT syndrome Wolf Parkinson White Syndrome Moderate / severe aortic stenosis Haemodynamic contraindications for adenosine, systolic pressure below 90
